diarrhea: Embarrassed, m_c reports to r_c that {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} stomachache is now having consequences at the other end of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} digestive system. r_c, as non-squeamish as all medicine cats, tells m_c that it's now very important {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/keep/keeps} drinking water, as the diarrhea will make {PRONOUN/m_c/object} lose it quickly.

bruises: r_c gently tends to m_c once the shaking has stopped. Asking them where it hurts and fluffing up the nest to try and soothe the new bruises.
m_c pants, gingerly wincing as they shift in their nest.
Even with the softest nest they could find, m_c still finds that they hurt beneath their fur.
sore: After ensuring that m_c is alright and secure, r_c gently massages the aches out of their body.
m_c whines, it's not enough just that they're still slightly shaking from residules, now all their muscles ache too.
If m_c close their eyes the pain isn't quite so bad, just a dull throb really. But it doesn't easily let them rest after their seizure.

bruises: Once m_c's limb stops spasming r_c carefully comes and checks them over. It would seem they have a few new bruises.
m_c sighs once their limb returns to their control, stretching it out and wincing when it feels tender.
sore: m_c complains to r_c that after all the spasming their limb feels tender and sore.
m_c winces, awkwardly trying to massage their limb to soothe the aching muscles.

panic attack: r_c carefully remains outside of m_c's personal space and attempts to count with them, desperately hoping the distraction will prevent their anxiety from further progressing to full panic.
m_c's tail lashes, eyes darting around the camp. Their paws dig into the dirt of the denfloor and they look moments away from bolting at the slightest movement.
Instead of fading the anxiety only seems to build and build until m_c feels like they can't breathe, everything is dangerous and wrong and they need out, out.

They can't breathe, m_c can't breathe drowning on land, drowning in the panic that floods their body putting all their fur on end.

shock: While the panic has faded away now m_c stares almost blankly, eyes darting making r_c worried that they have gone into a state of shock.
m_c's heart still races, pounding and echoing in their ears, they should be calm but they can't calm down. Panic continues to vividly repeat in their mind.
